I just finished your 30 days, the series from 5 years ago. Great introduction to Yoga, i really like your way of teaching and encouraging. I had some hiccups along the way and it took a little bit longer to get through those 30 sessions. Been doing Intermittent fasting and really struggling to lose weight, even paired with doing 30 minutes of physical activity nearly every day. But I do notice my strength.... my arms still look flabby as hell when i wave to people from across the room, BUT i locked myself out of the house yesterday and decided my best course of action would be to lift myself up through my bathroom window that sits at chest height from the ground. This was a difficult task and i said to myself "SELF... YOU CAN DO THIS... a month of yoga better count for something Self! LIFFFFTTT". A few minor injuries later i was through the window and not sure how i did it. Then i locked all the windows, cause that's just asking for trouble. xD.
Now i ask myself, what next? I'm untrained and not ready for making my own way with yoga. I am struggling a little with some of the activities because i have Degenerative Disc Disease, my PT tells me no Bending, Lifting, Twisting, Pushing, Pulling... every time i do some kind of twist my spine is like bubble wrap. I'm trying to work through these limitations slowly. I dont know what to do next, so Here i am, about to start your most recent 30 days of Yoga? Any recommendations would be appreciated.
Just starting this journey. Got away from my practice and yoga with Adriene and so glad and grateful to be back .â¤ï¸

This is my second 30 day Challenge with Adriene. It was great but just as was done on day 30 of my last challenge, it was done in silence with no cues. I have been doing yoga for over 40 years and although I know all the poses I have a hard time trying to see what you are doing. It kills my neck trying to see where we go next. Although the concept is great, it is difficult to try to watch you for all poses. I would have enjoyed it more with the cues.
Having said that, I have enjoyed my two Challenges and will continue to follow you! Thank you so much!
Is this program good for beginners?

Starting late. I was introduced to ywa 3 years ago which was also my first introduction to yoga in general. I completed the 30 days of yoga practice back then. I have been feeling down on myself lately and remembered how yoga helped me find my center and feel better about me as well as brighten my outlook on everyday life. So, sorry I am late but I'm super excited! Thank you for all of your videos! Namaste

no one will probably see this but Iâ€™m really putting this out there to keep myself accountable. lately my mental health has been crazy bad. I can go throughout my day fine but at night I just seem to always fall apart and I donâ€™t know why. Social media has taken such a toll on how I feel about myself and I guess without realizing it I let my mental health take a major backseat and now Iâ€™m paying the price. In an attempt to fix that Iâ€™m going to take things back to the basics and just try to commit for at least 30 days to doing this challenge, meditate for at least 10 minutes, and find what really makes me happy. Usually I always either get suckered in to big workout challenges and burn out really fast or I just go for long periods of hating the way I look or how my clothes fit and eating to make me feel better. I just want to feel good and I think with yoga I can do that and not worry about how big my stomach is or how bloated I feel. Fingers crossed I guess.

Hey Adriene!! So let me tell you what your yoga videos and your positive vibes means to me: I have been suffering with depression from a long time and even 2020 began with the same negativity- There was no hope left in me, I never smiled from the bottom of my heart, there was always something like a black hole inside me which kept on emptying me, I am overweight for my age which added up to the negativity and I hated myself for probably everything including my body. I was just drifting away in life without realizing my purpose and I even had suicidal thoughts. Then One day, one of my well wishers suggested me to follow your yoga videos while I was having a panic attack. Honestly, At first I thought that she was stupid to tell me to do yoga when I didn't have enough energy to even get out of bed in the morning. She asked me to take up the 30 days challenge. For her, I thought of starting to do yoga, but I followed your weight loss videos and not the 30 days challenge. And my good lord, The very first day everyone around me (including me) sensed a different kind of energy in me which had been vanished for years now. I lost weight fast which made me happier. Home was a big theme for me in 2019. At 43 years old I moved into my first flat. It's only rented, but it's mine. I have had a series of bad, unsafe feeling places to live in, with leaks, cold, damp, terrible landlords - you name it, and now I'm in my own space for the first time, and in a new town. I love my flat, but it is not easy to relax and enjoy this new beginning; I keep expecting the next disaster to happen (I keep checking the ceiling for leaks!). Yoga helped to relieve anxiety and balance me out last year, when I managed to stick to it. I'm looking forward to letting it help me again... and now I even have plenty of floor space for the yoga mat! Home indeed.

I felt like 2019 tore the scabs off a lot of wounds, traumas that I had blocked out started to feel fresh and raw. The latter half I scrambled for healing, not only for myself, but for my children. I saw some cycles starting, subtly, in my parenting journey as I learned that not only did I inherit trauma, but that there was a likelihood that I could pass it on. I'm dedicating my yoga practice to healing this year- in the past I would have looked at it as the type of discipline that is seen as punishment, and so my mat wasn't associated with safety. Luckily I received a new mat for Christmas, a new beginning, a chance to set new intentions, a new home. Thank you for offering to lead us on this journey. Namaste.
I am also trying to heal, and you are so right about not wanting to pass trauma on to your children. I need to heal so I don't do the same.
I had a similar year. I'm happy to pursue this healing with you.

Ha, I started my yoga practice again in November, with the 30 days of yoga. Challenge. I am still working through that 30 days of yoga. I have 6 more videos to go.
I was so nervous to get back into it, as I had injured my shoulder a while back. This time I would be extra mindful with my shoulder and the whole of my body.
Also during this time, I minimized everything, and made no commitments to anything other than yoga, work, home, family. I wanted to see what needs to be added back to life, and what can stay gone.
During my yoga sessions, I built up more strength than I imagined in just 15 yoga sessions. I was able to think more clearly, and.. My body told me that I needed to come back home, that I was capable of sustaining our family in a more healthful way if I was home.
And then I see the Home 30 days of yoga starting. Of course. Of course.
It's my goal to come back home in February.
I'm so looking forward to this!

Hi Adriene I'm a construction guy and gym rat for nearly 30 years. I found my flexibility and years of micro injuries from work and the gym taking its tole in the form of minor arthritis and loss of flexibility.
